title: <I>Zhi<I> (ritual wine cup)
description: Wine Cup \'CHI\', inscribed. The decor on a ground of spirals is one of restrained exuberance, dragonized t\'ao-t\'ieh (winged type) appear in the foot and neck belts, which are interrupted by shallow, flat flanges only on the long sides. The bodied t\'ao-t\'ieh on the belly displays tiny hooks on the forehead shield, and scores on the horns similar to those usually found on flanges. Two strongly stylized, head-turning dragons appear behind the feet of the t\'ao-t\'ieh. Rising blades, with spirals suggesting dissolved cicadas, adorn the neck of the vessel. The lid has two t\'ao-t\'ieh masks on a ground of squared spirals. Patina grey-green and blue-green. The meaning ofthe inscription, showing two arrows on a stand, is unknown.
